param.name: list_files
param.label: Select a collection list of TaqMan Low Density Array files in the history tab
param.help: Collection should be of category List.

param.name: files
param.label: Select one of the files in the history tab
param.help: File should contains only the fields: sampleName and Treatment.

param.name: formatFile
param.label: Select one of the file formats from the list below.

param.name: n
param.label: Type the number of miR\genes with a Ct value

section.name: dc
section.title: Categorization based on a category or a flag value

param.name: Ctmin
param.label: Set up a minimum Ct value
param.help: Any Ct below your selected value will be labelled as Unreliable.

param.name: Ctmax
param.label: Set up a maximum Ct value
param.help: Any Ct above your selected value will be labelled as Unreliable.

param.name: flag
param.label: Select TRUE if you want that PIPE-T categorizes a Ct value as Unreliable on the basis of EXPFAIL flag
param.help: Data in qPCRset objects will have feature categories (Unreliable, Undetermined) assigned to them based on different Ct criteria.

param.name: normMethod
param.label: Select one of the normalization methods from the list below.
param.help: Normalization is important to reduce technical variability from the data.

param.name: normalizers
param.label: Type a comma separated list of housekeeping miR\gene identifiers that will be used as normalizers.

section.name: df
section.title: Data filtering based on percentage of NAs and on names

param.name: percent
param.label: Set up a percentage of NAs.
param.help: miRs\genes with more than the specified percentage of NAs across samples will be removed.

param.name: filtname
param.label: Type a comma separeted list of miR\gene identifiers to filter out
param.help: miR\gene identifiers specified in the List will be removed.

param.name: format
param.label: Select one of the imputation methods from the list below.

param.name: k
param.label: Type a number of neighbors to use by the KNN imputation method

param.name: maxp
param.label: Type the largest number of miR\gene imputed by the KNN method.
param.help: Larger numbers are divided by two-means clustering (recursively) prior to imputation.

param.name: method
param.label: Select one of the methods from the list below or NONE.

param.name: alternative
param.label: Select one of the types of alternative hypothesis to assess significance.

param.name: paired
param.label: Select TRUE if you want a paired analysis?
param.help: Pairing of samples will follow the order of the sampleNames in the input file

param.name: replicates
param.label: Select TRUE if you have replicated miR\gene in your data
param.help: If replicated miRs\genes are present in the data, the statistics will be calculated once for each replicated miR\gene, rather than the separately.

param.name: sort
param.label: Select TRUE if you the output to be sorted by increasing order of p-value?

param.name: stringent
param.label: Select TRUE to admit more stringent analysis.
param.help: If stringent is TRUE any unreliable or undetermined measurements among technical and biological replicates will result in the final result being Undetermined. If stringent is FALSE result will be OK unless at least half of the Ct values for a given gene are unreliable/undetermined.

param.name: padjust
param.label: Select one of the methods to adjust pvalues for multiple hypothesis testing

tool.help: **What it does** INPUTS: This tool parses a list of RTqPCR file and a file with the groups OUTPUTS: and returs 1) A txt file with the raw Ct data 2) A PNG file with a boxplot of Ct data after data categorization for each sample 3) A txt file with deltaCt data after data normalization 4) A PNG file with the Empirical cumulative distribution before and after data normalization 5) A PNG file with boxplot of deltaCt data after data normalization 6) A txt file after imputation of missing values 7) A txt file with a number statistics about the significance of each miR\gene
